page.title: 16Interview with an Editor
page.content: {CLIFF GAROD }is an assistant to the editor.He started as a reporter in 1940.The {Evening Telegraph }was founded in 1897 at Kettering.Kettering was the smallest town to post the Evening paper.The Evening Telegraph carried news in the Boer war in South Africa, and had to restore news press to cope with the demand to news papers that the war created.All the war news arrived at the office in a form of telegrams .The Evening Telegraph soon installed wired telegraph equipment and the news could then be received on tape which was printed by machine.They used to call it Ticker Tape and it had to be printed onto sheets of paper. Today the E.T.is still installing up to date technology putting banks of teleprinters and each machine could receive news at about ninety words per minute.
